title: AB 458
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 99200 of the Education Code is amended to request the Regents of the University of California to establish cooperative endeavors to enhance teachers' subject matter knowledge, instructional strategies, and support for working with English learners. The Education Code is amended to request the Regents of the University of California to enhance teachers' subject matter knowledge and instructional strategies for working with English learners. Additionally, teachers are provided with strategies for delivering career-oriented content linked to high priority industry sectors. Provide teachers with access to current research linked to improved pupil learning and achievement on state tests and English language development assessments. Maintain subject-specific professional communities for teacher collaboration and learning. Develop teacher leaders with expertise in the classroom and content knowledge. Offer instructional strategies for collaboration on delivering career-oriented academic and technical content. The Concurrence Committee is responsible for ensuring compliance with requirements, developing rules, and providing reports on subject matter projects. The report includes information on participants' number and experience levels over a four-year period. The report from the Concurrence Committee includes details on participants' experience levels, annual funds spent, professional development activities offered, and affiliated schools for each subject matter project. Grants are available for institutions to establish local sites of statewide subject matter projects, which will be administered by the University of California in cooperation with the Concurrence Committee. These projects aim to serve school personnel in rural, urban, and suburban areas. The Concurrence Committee is made up of individuals from education leadership, management, or instruction backgrounds, with expertise in instructional strategies for English learners. Members are selected by various educational entities, including the Regents of the University of California, the Board of Trustees of the California State University, the State Board of Education, the Governor, the Superintendent of Public Instruction, the Commission on Teacher Credentialing, and the Curriculum Development and Supplemental Materials Commission. The Concurrence Committee comprises individuals from education leadership backgrounds with expertise in instructional strategies for English learners. Members are selected by various educational entities, including the Regents of the University of California, the Board of Trustees of the California State University, the State Board of Education, the Governor, the Superintendent of Public Instruction, the Commission on Teacher Credentialing, and the Curriculum Development and Supplemental Materials Commission. Representatives from California Community Colleges and independent postsecondary institutions are also included in the committee. The requirement for submitting a report is inoperative on January 1, 2018, and reports must comply with the Government Code.
